clusters.title: Giant tortoises return to Galápagos island after nearly 200 years
clusters.neutral_headline: Giant Tortoises Return To Galapagos Island

items.title: Giant tortoises return to Galápagos island after nearly 200 years
items.standfirst: One hundred and fifty eight captive-bred juvenile tortoises were released on the Galápagos island of Floreana.
items.content: One hundred and fifty eight captive-bred juvenile tortoises were released on the Galápagos island of Floreana.

items.title: Giant tortoises return to Galápagos island after nearly 200 years
items.standfirst: The native species was driven to extinction by sailors in the 1800s. Now, 158 juvenile giant tortoises have been reintroduced to the island.
items.content: The native species was driven to extinction by sailors in the 1800s. Now, 158 juvenile giant tortoises have been reintroduced to the island.

items.title: Giant tortoises return to Galapagos island after 150 years
items.standfirst: More than 150 giant tortoises have been reintroduced to Ecuador’s Floreana Island in the Galapagos.
items.content: More than 150 giant tortoises have been reintroduced to Ecuador’s Floreana Island in the Galapagos.

items.title: Giant tortoises make a comeback on Galapagos island
items.standfirst: More than 150 giant tortoises have been reintroduced to Floreana Island in Ecuador's famed Galapagos archipelago where they disappeared more than a century ago, the environment ministry said Friday. Floreana was once home to some 20,000 giant tortoises, but whaling, a devastating fire, and relentless human exploitation led to their complete extinction on the island.
items.content: More than 150 giant tortoises have been reintroduced to Floreana Island in Ecuador's famed Galapagos archipelago where they disappeared more than a century ago, the environment ministry said Friday. Floreana was once home to some 20,000 giant tortoises, but whaling, a devastating fire, and relentless human exploitation led to their complete extinction on the island.

items.title: Floreana giant tortoise reintroduced to Galápagos island after almost 200 years
items.standfirst: Subspecies driven to extinction by hungry whalers returns after ‘back breeding’ programme using partial descendantsGiant tortoises, the life-giving engineers of remote small island ecosystems, are plodding over the Galápagos island of Floreana for the first time in more than 180 years.The Floreana giant tortoise (Chelonoidis niger niger), a subspecies of the giant tortoise once found across the Galápagos, was driven to extinction in the 1840s by whalers who removed thousands from the volcanic island to provide a living larder during their hunting voyages. Continue reading...
items.content: Subspecies driven to extinction by hungry whalers returns after ‘back breeding’ programme using partial descendantsGiant tortoises, the life-giving engineers of remote small island ecosystems, are plodding over the Galápagos island of Floreana for the first time in more than 180 years.The Floreana giant tortoise (Chelonoidis niger niger), a subspecies of the giant tortoise once found across the Galápagos, was driven to extinction in the 1840s by whalers who removed thousands from the volcanic island to provide a living larder during their hunting voyages. Continue reading...

ai_summary: 158 captive bred tortoises released on Floreana island
Native species driven to extinction by sailors in 1800s
Tortoises reintroduced after nearly 200 years
Floreana island once home to 20,000 giant tortoises
Reintroduction part of conservation breeding program

clusters.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 10 in Lebanon, officials say
clusters.neutral_headline: Israeli Strikes Kill At Least 10 In Lebanon

items.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 10 in Lebanon, officials say
items.standfirst: The strikes are among the deadliest in Lebanon since a ceasefire ended the war between Israel and Hezbollah.
items.content: The strikes are among the deadliest in Lebanon since a ceasefire ended the war between Israel and Hezbollah.

items.title: Hezbollah says 'resistance' is the only choice after deadly Israeli strike
items.standfirst: A Hezbollah official on Saturday said that "resistance" was the only option after Israeli strikes in Lebanon killed eight of its operatives. On Friday, the Israeli military said it had hit Hezbollah command centres in eastern Lebanon and targets linked to the Palestinian group Hamas in the south.
items.content: A Hezbollah official on Saturday said that "resistance" was the only option after Israeli strikes in Lebanon killed eight of its operatives. On Friday, the Israeli military said it had hit Hezbollah command centres in eastern Lebanon and targets linked to the Palestinian group Hamas in the south.

items.title: At least 10 killed in Israeli strikes in Lebanon’s Bekaa valley, health ministry says
items.standfirst: Hezbollah leader among dead as Israel says it hit militant command centresAt least 10 people have been killed and 24 wounded – including three children – in Israeli strikes in Lebanon’s eastern Bekaa valley, the Lebanese health ministry has said.Israel said it had hit “command centres” of the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah. Two security sources told Reuters that the senior Hezbollah leader Hussein Yaghi was killed in the attacks. Continue reading...
items.content: Hezbollah leader among dead as Israel says it hit militant command centresAt least 10 people have been killed and 24 wounded – including three children – in Israeli strikes in Lebanon’s eastern Bekaa valley, the Lebanese health ministry has said.Israel said it had hit “command centres” of the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah. Two security sources told Reuters that the senior Hezbollah leader Hussein Yaghi was killed in the attacks. Continue reading...

items.title: At least 12 killed in Israeli strikes on Lebanon - including senior Hezbollah official
items.standfirst: Israeli airstrikes have killed at least 10 people in Lebanon's Bekaa Valley and another two people in a Palestinian refugee camp, the Lebanese Health Ministry has said.
items.content: Israeli airstrikes have killed at least 10 people in Lebanon's Bekaa Valley and another two people in a Palestinian refugee camp, the Lebanese Health Ministry has said.

clusters.title: Crews recover bodies of all 9 skiers killed in California avalanche
clusters.neutral_headline: All 9 Skiers Killed In California Avalanche Recovered

items.title: Crews recover bodies of all 9 skiers killed in California avalanche
items.standfirst: The bodies of all the skiers who died in Tuesday's avalanche near Lake Tahoe have been recovered, authorities said Saturday. Intense winter storm conditions delayed search and recovery efforts.
items.content: The bodies of all the skiers who died in Tuesday's avalanche near Lake Tahoe have been recovered, authorities said Saturday. Intense winter storm conditions delayed search and recovery efforts.(Image credit: Godofredo A. Vásquez/AP)

items.title: All 9 avalanche victims recovered from California's Sierra Nevada, sheriff says
items.standfirst: All nine avalanche victims have been recovered from California's Sierra Nevada, Nevada County Sheriff Shannan Moon said Saturday at a news conference.
items.content: All nine avalanche victims have been recovered from California's Sierra Nevada, Nevada County Sheriff Shannan Moon said Saturday at a news conference.

items.title: Bodies of all 9 California avalanche victims recovered, officials say
items.standfirst: In Northern California, authorities said they have recovered the bodies of all nine skiers killed in a backcountry avalanche earlier this week near Lake Tahoe. Severe weather prevented recovery teams from reaching the bodies sooner.
items.content: In Northern California, authorities said they have recovered the bodies of all nine skiers killed in a backcountry avalanche earlier this week near Lake Tahoe. Severe weather prevented recovery teams from reaching the bodies sooner.

items.title: All nine bodies of skiers killed in California avalanche recovered
items.standfirst: Six additional skiers survived tragedy in Sierra Nevadas near Lake Tahoe, a popular winter sport destination‘They were mothers, wives, friends’: how a ski trip turned deadly in the California mountainsOfficials announced on Saturday that the bodies of all nine missing skiers who were killed in a devastating avalanche in California had been recovered, following days of search efforts.The avalanche happened in the Sierra Nevada mountains in northern California near Lake Tahoe, a popular skiing and winter sport destination. No more people are left missing after Tuesday’s deadly avalanche. Continue reading...
items.content: Six additional skiers survived tragedy in Sierra Nevadas near Lake Tahoe, a popular winter sport destination‘They were mothers, wives, friends’: how a ski trip turned deadly in the California mountainsOfficials announced on Saturday that the bodies of all nine missing skiers who were killed in a devastating avalanche in California had been recovered, following days of search efforts.The avalanche happened in the Sierra Nevada mountains in northern California near Lake Tahoe, a popular skiing and winter sport destination. No more people are left missing after Tuesday’s deadly avalanche. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Bodies of all 9 skiers recovered from Sierra Nevada
Skiers killed in backcountry avalanche near Lake Tahoe
Six additional skiers survived the tragedy
Recovery efforts delayed due to severe weather
Avalanche occurred in popular winter sports destination

clusters.title: Trump threatens strikes on Iran as more warships enter Mediterranean
clusters.neutral_headline: US Ramps Up Military Buildup In Middle East

items.title: Trump threatens strikes on Iran as more warships enter Mediterranean
items.standfirst: President Trump warned Friday that limited strikes on Iran are possible as he pressures the country to dismantle its nuclear program. The U.S. is continuing to ramp up its firepower in the Middle East, with the aircraft carrier USS Gerald Ford and three other warships entering the Mediterranean Sea on Friday.
items.content: President Trump warned Friday that limited strikes on Iran are possible as he pressures the country to dismantle its nuclear program. The U.S. is continuing to ramp up its firepower in the Middle East, with the aircraft carrier USS Gerald Ford and three other warships entering the Mediterranean Sea on Friday.

items.title: Iran prepares nuclear counterproposal as US considers limited military strikes
items.standfirst: Trump orders massive buildup of naval forces in Middle East, leading to fears of an imminent warIran’s foreign minister has said he expects to have a draft counterproposal ready within days after nuclear talks with the US this week, while Donald Trump said he was considering limited military strikes.The US president has ordered a massive buildup of naval forces in the Middle East, including repositioning aircraft carriers and other warships, leading to fears of an imminent war. But it is not clear if the military movements are intended as an intimidation tactic to put pressure on Iran to make concessions on its nuclear programme. Continue reading...
items.content: Trump orders massive buildup of naval forces in Middle East, leading to fears of an imminent warIran’s foreign minister has said he expects to have a draft counterproposal ready within days after nuclear talks with the US this week, while Donald Trump said he was considering limited military strikes.The US president has ordered a massive buildup of naval forces in the Middle East, including repositioning aircraft carriers and other warships, leading to fears of an imminent war. But it is not clear if the military movements are intended as an intimidation tactic to put pressure on Iran to make concessions on its nuclear programme. Continue reading...

items.title: US ramps up military buildup in Middle East amid talks with Iran
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said on Friday that limited strikes against Iran are possible even as the country’s top diplomat said Tehran expects to have a proposed deal ready in the next few days following nuclear talks with the United States. Trump's warning came as the USS Gerald R. Ford carrier strike group passed through the Strait of Gibraltar and entered the Mediterranean Sea after being sent by Trump from the Caribbean, according to images of the ship by maritime photographers posted to social media.
items.content: President Donald Trump said on Friday that limited strikes against Iran are possible even as the country’s top diplomat said Tehran expects to have a proposed deal ready in the next few days following nuclear talks with the United States. Trump's warning came as the USS Gerald R. Ford carrier strike group passed through the Strait of Gibraltar and entered the Mediterranean Sea after being sent by Trump from the Caribbean, according to images of the ship by maritime photographers posted to social media.

ai_summary: US considers limited military strikes on Iran
Aircraft carrier USS Gerald Ford enters Mediterranean
Iran prepares nuclear counterproposal
US pressures Iran to dismantle nuclear program
Military buildup sparks fears of imminent war

clusters.title: NASA's Artemis II lunar mission may not launch in March after all

items.title: NASA's Artemis II lunar mission may not launch in March after all
items.standfirst: NASA says an "interrupted flow" of helium to the rocket system could require a rollback to the Vehicle Assembly Building. If it happens, NASA says the launch to the moon would be delayed until April.
items.content: NASA says an "interrupted flow" of helium to the rocket system could require a rollback to the Vehicle Assembly Building. If it happens, NASA says the launch to the moon would be delayed until April.(Image credit: Gregg Newton)

items.title: Nasa may roll back Artemis II rocket launch after helium flow discovery
items.standfirst: Agency statement comes one day after announcement of 6 March target for astronauts’ mission to circle the moonNasa said in a blog post on Saturday it is taking steps to potentially roll back the Artemis II rocket launch after discovering an interrupted flow of helium.The agency said it is taking steps to roll the Artemis II rocket and Orion spacecraft back to the vehicle assembly building at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida. Continue reading...
items.content: Agency statement comes one day after announcement of 6 March target for astronauts’ mission to circle the moonNasa said in a blog post on Saturday it is taking steps to potentially roll back the Artemis II rocket launch after discovering an interrupted flow of helium.The agency said it is taking steps to roll the Artemis II rocket and Orion spacecraft back to the vehicle assembly building at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida. Continue reading...

ai_summary: NASA delays Artemis II launch due to technical issue

clusters.title: Thousands march after killing of far-right activist in France
clusters.neutral_headline: Thousands March After Killing Of Far Right Activist

items.title: Thousands march after killing of far-right activist in France
items.standfirst: Some 3,000 people joined a march in France on Saturday after the killing of a far-right activist in an incident that shocked the nation.
items.content: Some 3,000 people joined a march in France on Saturday after the killing of a far-right activist in an incident that shocked the nation.

items.title: 'Heavy', 'sad' and 'increasingly intense' atmosphere at rally for killed far-right activist
items.standfirst: Several hundreds joined a march organised by far-right groups on Saturday after a nationalist activist died from a beating in Lyon in an incident that highlighted a climate of deep political tensions ahead of next year's presidential vote. Reporting from Lyon, FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot said the atmosphere was "heavy, sad and increasingly intense", adding that "several young men carrying wooden sticks" were present at the rally.
items.content: Several hundreds joined a march organised by far-right groups on Saturday after a nationalist activist died from a beating in Lyon in an incident that highlighted a climate of deep political tensions ahead of next year's presidential vote. Reporting from Lyon, FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot said the atmosphere was "heavy, sad and increasingly intense", adding that "several young men carrying wooden sticks" were present at the rally.

items.title: Thousands expected to attend rally for killed far-right activist
items.standfirst: Some two to three thousand people are expected to attend a march Saturday in Lyon for a far right activist killed last week. With ultra-right groups expected to attend the march, tensions are high with President Emmanuel Macron urging calm ahead of the event. FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot reports from Lyon.
items.content: Some two to three thousand people are expected to attend a march Saturday in Lyon for a far right activist killed last week. clusters.title: World's tallest church: Sagrada Familia inches closer to the sky

items.title: World's tallest church: Sagrada Familia inches closer to the sky
items.standfirst: Barcelona's towering Sagrada Familia basilica reached its maximum height on Friday, though the magnum opus of Catalan architect Antoni Gaudí remains years away from completion. A crane placed the upper arm of a cross atop the Tower of Jesus Christ, the church's soaring central piece, which now stands 172.5 meters (566 feet) above the city.
items.content: Barcelona's towering Sagrada Familia basilica reached its maximum height on Friday, though the magnum opus of Catalan architect Antoni Gaudí remains years away from completion. A crane placed the upper arm of a cross atop the Tower of Jesus Christ, the church's soaring central piece, which now stands 172.5 meters (566 feet) above the city.

items.title: ‘A joyful day’: final piece of Sagrada Familia’s central tower put in place
items.standfirst: Completion of glass cross brings Antoni Gaudí’s church to maximum final height of 172.5m, 144 years after work beganThe final piece of the central tower of Barcelona’s Sagrada Familia has been laid in place, bringing the church to its maximum final height 144 years after work began.After several days when it has been too windy to work, the upper section of the 17 metre-high four-sided steel and glass cross was winched into position at 11am on Friday, completing the tower dedicated to Jesus Christ. At 172.5 metres, the Sagrada Familia, to which the Catalan architect Antoni Gaudí devoted the later part of his life, is Barcelona’s tallest building and the world’s tallest church. Continue reading...
items.content: Completion of glass cross brings Antoni Gaudí’s church to maximum final height of 172.5m, 144 years after work beganThe final piece of the central tower of Barcelona’s Sagrada Familia has been laid in place, bringing the church to its maximum final height 144 years after work began.After several days when it has been too windy to work, the upper section of the 17 metre-high four-sided steel and glass cross was winched into position at 11am on Friday, completing the tower dedicated to Jesus Christ. At 172.5 metres, the Sagrada Familia, to which the Catalan architect Antoni Gaudí devoted the later part of his life, is Barcelona’s tallest building and the world’s tallest church. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Sagrada Familia reaches maximum height of 172 meters
Final piece of central tower put in place
Church designed by Antoni Gaudi
Construction began 144 years ago
Sagrada Familia is world's tallest church

clusters.title: UK govt mulls removing ex-prince Andrew from line of succession
clusters.neutral_headline: UK Government Considers Removing Prince Andrew From Succession

items.title: UK govt mulls removing ex-prince Andrew from line of succession
items.standfirst: The British government on Friday mulled passing a law to remove former prince Andrew from the line of succession, as police stepped up investigations into his conduct, quizzing the disgraced royal's former protection officers. The former prince was arrested on Thursday at his new home on the king's remote Sandringham estate in eastern Norfok on suspicion of misconduct in public office.
items.content: The British government on Friday mulled passing a law to remove former prince Andrew from the line of succession, as police stepped up investigations into his conduct, quizzing the disgraced royal's former protection officers. The former prince was arrested on Thursday at his new home on the king's remote Sandringham estate in eastern Norfok on suspicion of misconduct in public office.

items.title: British government considers removing former Prince Andrew from the royal line of succession
items.standfirst: The British government is considering formally removing Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor from the royal line of succession once the police investigation into allegations of misconduct in public office has concluded, a source familiar with the deliberations told NBC News
items.content: The British government is considering formally removing Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor from the royal line of succession once the police investigation into allegations of misconduct in public office has concluded, a source familiar with the deliberations told NBC News

ai_summary: UK government considers removing Prince Andrew from line of succession
Prince Andrew arrested on suspicion of misconduct
Investigation into Prince Andrew's conduct ongoing
Government may pass law to remove Prince Andrew from succession
